poem:
Flames in the Wind  

Red tongues  
curl, devour—  
a brush of whispers,  
fierce wind rehearses  
across the dry canvas.  
Homes like scattered leaves—  
the urgent air pushes  
them, unseen hands  
urging flight.  
Smoke billows,  
a torn veil  
against the blue;  
lives suspended  
in the whirling  
dance of earth  
and sky.
